meta.description: The Centurion Lounge at San Francisco International Airport (SFO), Terminal 3, Concourse F. Learn more about the lounge: amenities, photos, review, opening hours, location.

lounge.name: The Centurion Lounge

location.terminalDirections: Located post-security in Terminal 3, at the connector to G Gates.

lounge.description:
From the moment you walk in, you'll see that things are different here. Unexpected touches like a Napa Valley wine tasting area and a well-appointed shower suite meet productive workspaces with high-speed Wi-Fi.

Learn more at thecenturionlounge.com/locations/sfo/

regulatory: The Centurion Lounge is a day of departure lounge. Arriving Platinum and Delta SkyMiles Reserve Card Members with boarding passes for flights that have just landed will not be admitted.

Platinum and Delta SkyMiles Reserve Card Members will not be admitted more than 3 hours before the departure time on their same-day, confirmed boarding pass. This does not apply to Platinum and Delta SkyMiles Reserve Card Members with a connecting flight.

reviews.content: Amazing US lounge! It rivals asia lounges
new bar in back lot better also have food mote room
Nothing special    not much food  drinks nothing special...
Arrived w/less than an hour before closing & from the time we checked in with Miriam on the app (super easy) to Joseph arranging sitting & food to Delphin at the bar, everything was taken care of! TY
Not what I expect at all. It‚Äôs small and the lines are long. The hours for food and drinks should match the hours of operations.
Way too crowded! Huge line for food and nowhere for people in line to even stand.
Here 10:30 pm before close. Receptionist was rude. No hi, only this bar is closing and there is only soup and salad like she didn‚Äôt want me there.  No WiFi password card. Going to UAL club :(
When I visited (a Sunday) it was pretty quiet. I ate two meals and charged all devices. Grateful for the stay!
Came for shower and espresso. Fail on both-neither available.              Ps: This lounge appears to be the opposite of exclusive. It's so packed.  Hard to believe these are all Centurion members.
Showers were out of service. Food was marked with vegetarian and ‚Äúcontains dairy‚Äù to make it a little easier for vegans.
Only standing rooms left at 12pm on a Friday. This lounge feels like a bus stop now. This constant overcrowding is getting out of hand.
This place has gone downhill. From the rude front desk staff to the robotic no-smile bartenders. Food is still quality but the attitudes need significant adjustments.
Just noticed that they no longer have top shelf scotch anymore. Just red labels. I guess beggars can‚Äôt be choosers.
Love the lounge but arrived 3 hours and 10 min before flight, would not let us in. Said you have to come back in 10 min.  Lady at the desk was super rude. Then said we couldn‚Äôt wait there. Rude!!
Overcrowded. Sometimes whole lot of people needs to stand near the bar like a bar party. Don‚Äôt expect to be able to relax and all.
Very nice lounge but QUITE crowded even at 9a on a Saturday. Needs to be much bigger to accommodate the demand.
Most complaints on LB are about their entry policies (departure only, 3hr window, confirmed seat) and not the lounge. This is certainly the best lounge at the domestic terminals period. Get over it.
Food menu only has a few options, but well seasoned, prepared, nice pallet. During busy times the crowding was ridiculous - though off hours it was a beautiful experience. Bar nicely stocked.
Good decor but space way too small and food offering is mediocre at best.
Departure lounge only, then now they are limiting entry to 3 hours before your flight. Food is OK, space is way too small.
For an Amex lounge this is way too small. Very limited seating. Much of the seating is hard plastic restaurant style seats. Many people standing waiting to find seating. People standing eating food.
This lounge not up there for my expectations, it‚Äôs very mediocre. Food doesn‚Äôt change and not much variety as well. Clean utensils run out or they have leftover food on them. Very disappointing.
Just a note this is a departure only lounge! As of March 2019 you can no longer access the lounge for arrivals.

One thing you must know is that this Centurion lounge is only accessible from Terminal 3 and the International Terminal. If you are leaving from another terminal you have to go through security twice.
Service staff excellent. Not unusually crowded, but a busy lounge. Food quality far above average.
Crowded but always a great experience. Attentive service. Love the food. Terrific that they have healthy and delicious options. Lagunitas on tap doesn‚Äôt hurt either. In my top five.

The energy of a nightclub but at anytime, so not relaxing but worth seeing. I keep making the trek to Air France where I can serve myself. Front staff great, b-tenders less so. Too bad limiting access.
Lovely as all AmEx lounges, but always always jammed. Good food & drink options and great location for either T3 or International flights. Pleasant staff. Hard to find a seat.
Service is always great at Centurion lounges but I‚Äôve never been at one which wasn‚Äôt busy. Food is excellent and caters especially to vegans and vegetarians. High quality!

Absolutely overcrowded. Amex needs to do something about the masses of people using this lounge. Almost every time I have gone here, there has been no seating room and I have had to go somewhere else.
Horrible.  I was denied access after landing in SFO waiting for colleagues to arrive on other flights. ‚ÄúCrowd control‚Äù was cited with at least 2 dozen open seats visible to me at front desk.
Great lounge, just another bonus of being an Amex member. Food was great. How French toast and quiche? Unlike other lounges with microwave waffles and powder eggs.
So horribly overcrowded that I could not sit anywhere. Tons of children and a bartender with bad attitude. I left.
Crowded lounge in a crowded terminal. Too small for SFO. AMEX counts infants under 1 yr as guests. Airlines and hotels don‚Äôt. Had a Sophie‚Äôs Choice situation trying to check in and left.
Like hanging out in a daycare. Kids running around everywhere, totally overcrowded. It‚Äôs more calm in the main terminal. This is the worst of the Centurion Lounges.
Crowded. Bartender was rude when asked for a glass of water, which I later on saw that there was a dispenser for water for self serve. Food was terrible.
Very crowded at any given time but since my departure gate was right across from this lounge this made it quite convenient. Great cocktails, as always...... ü•É
If it's not super crowded, this is a truly phenomenal lounge. Best lounge food at SFO and a great bar. Has a tendency to be overcrowded though.
Friendly staff, clean but sometimes crowded. Food selection OK, great showers (there‚Äôs only one, you‚Äôll get a pager at the front desk).
This lounge used to be packed but they seem to have resolved that by making people wait to enter until their departure time is < 3 hours away. It‚Äôd be okay if attendant weren‚Äôt rude about it...
The bar does not open until 6am but the food is incredibly good.
The lounge is under capacity control and will only allow guests in 3 hours prior to their flights.
Crowded, but good food and far better than a United Club. Returned a year later, and at 7pm not crowded, so very nice.
Most crowded of the Centurion Lounges I have been to... which makes it less relaxing.
This is a fantastic lounge and it's domestic too. If you make 10 or more trips to SFO this makes the platinum card worth it just by itself!
Like another reviewer said, it‚Äôs way too busy but good food and nice place. The bartender could be a bit more gentle but the receptionist was on top of her game.
Too crowded. Hard to find space.
Great food, drinks, facilities, etc. Can get too crowded at times.
OVERCROWDED. A LOUNGE IS USELESS WHEN YOU CANNOT SIT AND SOMEWHAT RELAX.
After a trek in and out of security from terminal 2 (no access after security) I joined several hundred sweaty tired travelers in a lounge built for 75. It‚Äôs literally the hunger games in here.
Very overcrowded. Couldn‚Äôt find a spot. Food was good once I finally found a seat. Took forever to get a drink. It‚Äôs only good when it‚Äôs not overcrowded.
Excellent service + elevated F&B options. It was full but managed to secure a seat. Expect the typical CL decor but SF-inspired cuisine. Highly recommend.
Always great! Bartender hooked me up, food was delicious! You guys are Amazeballs.
Fantastic food here. Hope it is not so crowded. That will make it perfect.
Nice food and facilities but it's so crowded you have to fight for a seat.
The kids room is a blessing for family travelers!
Visited Saturday around 10AM. A noisy, overcrowded mess. Worst lounge I‚Äôve been too in ages. Luckily had access to the United Club in E Concourse, which was much nicer.
Stopped in at 7:45pm on a Friday - luckily flying out of gate 74. Grabbed a quick bite and drink. Able to grab seats right away. A bit crowded, but manageable. Food and wine were both outstanding.
Screaming kids. Sound of dishes thrown around. Unfriendly bartender. But front desk staff were excellent. Disappointed in American Express.
Excellent lounge and great food. There are certain times where this place gets really crowded and they have to control entry.
Excellent lounge. Very crowded.
Mostly a great lounge. The food is top quality. The drinks flow freely and the staff is attentive. The only negative is that the place is almost always packed, and often by a lot of low-class people.
Compared to United lounges, a big upgrade. Unfortunately it gets really crowded at times. Other times are surprisingly relaxed volume. Food is great, always something a little different. Healthy.
Over Christmas, with United Club undergoing renovations, this place was a zoo. Literally standing room only. That said, great bar and hot food options, with staff working as hard as they can.
No free seats. No places to seat. Too many peoples.
This is the 3rd AMEX Lounge I have been to (SEA & LAS the other two). I would say overall, this was the best one I have been to so far. Food offerings are very good. FYI - It can get crowded.
One of the best lounges I‚Äôve been to in the US.  Great food and nice environment. Wine vending machine! I highly recommend stopping by if you have some time!
Excellent food, facilities, and service.  Probably best club in any US airport. Lack of plentiful power, though.
I think...the best lounge in SFO...
I always make a point of stopping in on departure and arrival. Can be very crowded, but once you are settled, it‚Äôs the best!
Nice place to relax and get away from the busy gates at SFO.
The lounge has waves of people but the turnaround is pretty quick and finding seating was relatively easy. Food was tasty and fast service; those cooks are working hard! Clean bathrooms, nice staff.
Extremely busy lounge. May feel more crowded than the sitting areas outside the lounge. Like other Centurion Lounges, food is delicious. Relatively quiet for the number of people. Courteous staff.
Excellent food spread, with plenty to eat for vegetarians as well!
The space is well designed with a variety of comfortable places to sit, relax and eat. There is also very accessible outlets for charging your technology. Wifi was fast.
Miriam at the front desk was so nice and accommodating. She was simply amazing.
Probably one of the best lounge I have done. Great service, great food, great drinks. Will definitely come back next time I fly from SFO!
We always book out flights out of SFO just to come here. TSA knows that people come through this gate just for this lounge and it's not a problem.

Fruit flies shouldn't exist at a bar buried inside an airport. It tells that the kitchen/bar should be cleaner. Also the bar was out of key cocktail ingredients, this isn't the first time seeing this.
This place is a great respite within SFO. The food is good and cocktails delicious. It's crowded so you do have to hunt for a spot.
Great lounge but for SFO it is severely inadequate. There are just toooo many people here all the time. Amex makes mad money on people that use these cards so this lounge is inexcusable.
Among the best lounges in the US, healthy and fresh food options and awesome cocktails! Only drawback is that there are no views of the tarmac.
I love the breakfast menu, but don't expect this place to be a sanctuary from airport madness. Not an open seat in the house a 9:30am on a Saturday.

Very crowded at 9:30am Wednesday morning. Food good, service excellent. 

**TSA AGENT REFUSED OUR ACCESS TO THIS LOUNGE when we didnt have a flight from terminal 3, so we have to fly United to access.
Quality food and friendly services.
Great food and friendly service. Excellent beverage choices. Can get crowded even at off hours. Some of the chairs have seen better days.

The shower is fantastic, the bar is well stocked, food selection is not big but good fresh quality, service is very friendly. Only drawback is that it can get very crowded. And ice cream is missing ;)
Friendly staff & great food. Coffee station could use some work. Conveniently located and always an enjoyable stay here before a flight.
The food is for adults--not the usual "disguised sugar," but with actual savory flavors. Comfortable seating, excellent bar, and a "quiet group of friends" feel. Very professional staff top it off.
Great lounge, much better than United Club. It was a little crowded but food and bar were great. Open bar with top notch brands. Good wine selection also.
Awesome lounge. Always a little on the crowded side, but I've never failed to find a seat and the food is invariably great.
A most impressive lounge. The food is one of the best I've had at a lounge, and the alcohol menu is impressive.
Only concern is this lounge gets busy during rush flying hours. Ask a staff member to help you find a seat as they will ask those sitting alone to make room for you!
Outstanding lounge, easily accessible from International G (just walk past United Club towards T3 right after security), great food and bev options. Can get crowded in the pm.
Unbelievable lounge. Excellent food, top shelf liquor and wine tasting? Unreal.
Certainly the best lounge I've visited in Continental US. Good variety of food and beverages. It could certainly use more electrical outlets, but it's not too bad. I would absolutely visit again.
Nice modern lounge. Good food including fresh fruit. Nice seating and good WiFi.
Too small, too crowded. Too few electrical sockets. Breakfast selection too mediocre. Couldn't find a place to sit on a Saturday morning! What a disappointment! Even the United Club was far superior.
Best lounge I've ever visited. Cancelled my Amex Platinum because I don't fly through SFO as much anymore but it's still worth the $50 fee using any other Amex card for access.
Fabulous food. Great wine.  Friendly personnel.

location.terminalDirections: Concourse F, located after Gate F13.
Between Concourses E and F, near Gate E3.
Located in the central Rotunda area, near the Food Court before Gates F5-F20.
